did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: First Presbyterian Church in Durham, NC was organized in 1871. The collection includes a scrapbook, historical sketches, and article.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], First Presbyterian Church (Durham, N.C.) Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The First Presbyterian Church (Durham, N.C.) Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1970.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: First Presbyterian Church in Durham, NC was organized in 1871.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains copies of a typescript volume entitled "First Presbyterian Church, Durham, N.C., 1870-1920," written and compiled by Sadie Blount (Mrs. R.D.) Blacknall. A scrapbook contains letters, legal and financial papers, church bulletins, issues of the "Presbyterian Monthly" and "Presbyterian Messenger" published in Durham, booklets, photographs including some of other Durham Presbyterian churches and clippings about the church.

did.unittitle: Historical Sketch of the Church by Robert F. Durden
Durham Morning Herald article, A Century of Service, 1971 Dec. 26
